definition: any of numerous birds (family Picidae) with zygodactyl feet, stiff spiny tail feathers used in climbing or resting on tree trunks, a usually extensible tongue, a very hard bill used to drill the bark or wood of trees for insect food or to excavate nesting cavities, and generally showy parti-colored plumage
sentence: The woodpecker tapped on the tree trunk.

definition: of, relating to, or characteristic of youth
sentence: Her youthful energy is inspiring.

definition: something supplied for convenience or to satisfy a need: such as
sentence: The hotel provides comfortable accommodation for business travelers.

definition: something that has accumulated or has been accumulated
sentence: The accumulation of snow blocked the mountain roads.

definition: of or relating to administration or an administration : relating to the management of a company, school, or other organization
sentence: The administrative staff handles all the paperwork and scheduling.

definition: feeling or showing affection or warm regard : loving
sentence: She was an affectionate mother who always hugged her children.

definition: a sudden advance especially in knowledge or technique

definition: the act of working with another person or group to create or produce something
sentence: The project was a collaboration between two universities.

definition: a nation, state, or other political unit: such as

definition: tending to communicate : talkative

definition: complexity, intricacy; especially : a situation or a detail of character complicating the main thread of a plot

definition: to express vicarious pleasure to (a person) on the occasion of success or good fortune; also : to feel pleased with

definition: a woman who is a member of a congress; especially : a woman who is a member of the U.S. House of Representatives
sentence: The congresswoman proposed a new healthcare bill.

definition: declared such by judicial construction or interpretation

definition: marked by cooperation
sentence: The cooperative effort resulted in a successful project.

definition: presenting observations about the characteristics of someone or something : serving to describe
sentence: The author's descriptive writing painted vivid images.

definition: causing destruction : ruinous

definition: loss or damage especially to reputation, credit, or finances : detriment

definition: of or relating to discipline
sentence: The school took disciplinary action against the students.

definition: marked by eminence, distinction, or excellence

definition: something that distracts : an object that directs one's attention away from something else; especially : amusement

definition: filled with or marked by enthusiasm
sentence: The crowd gave an enthusiastic welcome to the band.

definition: an act or instance of exaggerating something : overstatement of the truth : a statement that exaggerates something
sentence: Saying the fish was huge was no exaggeration.

definition: the act or state of expecting : anticipation
sentence: The movie lived up to everyone's expectation.

definition: of, relating to, or based on experience or experiment
sentence: The treatment is still in the experimental phase.

definition: going beyond what is usual, regular, or customary; specifically : of or relating to a proceeding or action not normally required by law
sentence: The athlete showed extraordinary talent.

definition: of or relating to grammar
sentence: The sentence contains a grammatical error.

definition: a small usually square piece of cloth used for usually personal purposes (such as blowing the nose) or as a clothing accessory
sentence: He pulled out a handkerchief to wipe his face.

definition: of, relating to, or characterized by sexual or romantic attraction to or between people of the opposite sex
sentence: The study included both heterosexual and homosexual participants.

definition: an act of identifying : the state of being identified
sentence: Please show your identification at the entrance.

definition: absolutely necessary : essential
sentence: Water is indispensable for human survival.

definition: to make industrial
sentence: The country began to industrialize in the nineteenth century.

definition: too many to be numbered : countless; also : very many
sentence: There are innumerable stars in the sky.

definition: a place or area where two or more things (such as streets) intersect

definition: a detailed examination or inquiry
sentence: Police launched an investigation into the theft.

definition: characterized by opulence, sumptuousness, or rich abundance : of, relating to, or marked by luxury
sentence: The hotel suite was absolutely luxurious.

definition: consisting of diverse things or members : heterogeneous
sentence: The drawer is full of miscellaneous items.

definition: the act or process of giving someone a reason for doing something : the act or process of motivating someone
sentence: He lacked the motivation to finish the project.

definition: of, relating to, or constituting mystery
sentence: The mysterious stranger disappeared without a trace.

definition: so important that you must do it or have it : absolutely needed

definition: the action or process of negotiating or being negotiated —often used in plural
sentence: The negotiation lasted for several hours.

definition: neighborly relationship
sentence: The neighborhood is quiet and safe.

definition: nourishing
sentence: A nutritious breakfast starts your day right.

definition: one who practices photography; especially : one who makes a business of taking photographs
sentence: The photographer captured beautiful moments.

definition: the action or process of making something ready for use or service or of getting ready for some occasion, test, or duty
sentence: Good preparation is key to success.

definition: treatment of mental or emotional disorder or of related bodily ills by psychological means
sentence: The patient began psychotherapy for anxiety.

definition: a restriction in meaning or application : a limiting modification

definition: an instance of reflecting; especially : the return of light or sound waves from a surface
sentence: He saw his reflection in the mirror.

definition: someone or something that represents: such as

definition: serving to represent

definition: the payment through penance of the temporal punishment incurred by a sin

definition: giving satisfaction : adequate

definition: lacking foresight

definition: existing or occurring at the same time : exactly coincident
sentence: The events occurred in simultaneous translation.

definition: of, relating to, or being a spectacle : striking, sensational

definition: the act or an instance of starving

definition: to excite to activity or growth or to greater activity : animate, arouse

definition: the act of signing one's name (as in attesting or witnessing a document)

definition: following in order : following each other without interruption

definition: a belief or practice resulting from ignorance, fear of the unknown, trust in magic or chance, or a false conception of causation
sentence: Breaking a mirror is a common superstition.

definition: of, relating to, or swayed by superstition

definition: the action, process, or occupation of supervising; especially : a critical watching and directing (as of activities or a course of action)
sentence: Children need adult supervision at all times.

definition: the circumstances, conditions, or objects by which one is surrounded : environment
sentence: Take time to enjoy your surroundings.

definition: close watch kept over someone or something (as by a detective); also : supervision
sentence: The store uses video surveillance for security.

definition: tending to arouse suspicion : questionable
sentence: The security guard noticed suspicious behavior.

definition: existing or operating through an affinity, interdependence, or mutual association
sentence: She was sympathetic to his problems.

definition: to be in keeping, accord, or harmony
sentence: I sympathize with your difficult situation.

definition: relating to or involving synthesis : not analytic
sentence: The jacket is made of synthetic material.

definition: relating to or consisting of a system
sentence: The scientist used a systematic approach.

definition: given to talking; also : full of talk
sentence: The talkative child rarely stopped chatting.

definition: having special and usually practical knowledge especially of a mechanical or scientific subject
sentence: The manual provides technical information.

definition: of, relating to, or characterized by technology
sentence: Technological advances have changed our lives.

definition: communication at a distance (as by telephone)
sentence: The company works in telecommunications.

definition: the act of tempting or the state of being tempted especially to evil : enticement
sentence: He couldn't resist the temptation to eat cake.

definition: after that
sentence: He graduated and shortly thereafter found a job.

definition: an instrument for determining temperature; specifically : one consisting of a sensor housed in a metal probe that registers a change in electrical resistance as a change in temperature
sentence: The thermometer showed a high temperature.

definition: carried through to completion : exhaustive
sentence: The detective made a thorough investigation.

definition: something formed in the mind: such as
sentence: She was lost in thought.

definition: absorbed in thought : meditative
sentence: It was thoughtful of you to bring flowers.

definition: all the way from one end to the other of : in or to every part of
sentence: She remained calm throughout the crisis.

definition: a brush for cleaning the teeth
sentence: Replace your toothbrush every three months.

definition: a series of games or contests that make up a single unit of competition (as on a professional golf tour), the championship playoffs of a league or conference, or an invitational event
sentence: She won first place in the tennis tournament.

definition: an inherited, established, or customary pattern of thought, action, or behavior (such as a religious practice or a social custom)
sentence: They follow the tradition of their ancestors.

definition: something transacted; especially : an exchange or transfer of goods, services, or funds
sentence: The bank records every transaction.

definition: an act, process, or instance of transforming or being transformed
sentence: The city underwent a dramatic transformation.

definition: a change or shift from one state, subject, place, etc. to another
sentence: The transition to the new system took time.

definition: an act, process, or instance of translating: such as
sentence: The translation was accurate and clear.

definition: an act, process, or instance of transmitting
sentence: There was a problem with the car's transmission.

definition: an act, process, or instance of transporting or being transported
sentence: Public transportation is reliable here.

definition: difficult, burdensome
sentence: The troublesome student disrupted class.

definition: not conditional or limited : absolute, unqualified
sentence: Parents often provide unconditional love.

definition: to estimate as being less than the actual size, quantity, or number
sentence: Never underestimate your opponent.

definition: a student at a college or university who has not received a first and especially a bachelor's degree
sentence: She is an undergraduate student at the university.

definition: lying beneath or below
sentence: The underlying cause of the problem remains unclear.

definition: not doubted : genuine, undisputed
sentence: She is undoubtedly the best candidate for the job.

definition: the state of being unemployed : involuntary idleness of workers; also : the rate of such unemployment
sentence: Unemployment rates have fallen this year.

definition: the act, process, or result of unifying : the state of being unified
sentence: The unification of the country brought peace.

definition: the act or process of varying : the state or fact of being varied
sentence: There is little variation in temperature here.

definition: embracing a variety of subjects, fields, or skills; also : turning with ease from one thing to another
sentence: The versatile actor plays many different roles.

definition: perpendicular to the plane of the horizon or to a primary axis : upright
sentence: The cliff face was almost vertical.

definition: a person qualified and authorized to practice veterinary medicine
sentence: The veterinarian specializes in farm animals.

definition: a periodic motion of the particles of an elastic body or medium in alternately opposite directions from the position of equilibrium when that equilibrium has been disturbed (as when a stretched cord produces musical tones or molecules in the air transmit sounds to the ear)
sentence: The vibration from the machine was noticeable.

definition: the act of violating : the state of being violated: such as
sentence: The violation resulted in a heavy fine.

definition: of, relating to, or concerned with a vocation
sentence: The school offers vocational training programs.

definition: a game played by volleying an inflated ball over a net; also : the ball used in this game
sentence: They play volleyball at the beach.

definition: proceeding from the will or from one's own choice or consent
sentence: Participation in the program is voluntary.

definition: impervious to water; especially : covered or treated with a material (such as a solution of rubber) to prevent permeation by water
sentence: Make sure your jacket is waterproof.

definition: about where : near what place
sentence: The police are trying to determine his whereabouts.

definition: widely diffused or prevalent
sentence: The disease became widespread across the region.

definition: a tract or region uncultivated and uninhabited by human beings
sentence: They camped in the wilderness for a week.

definition: a transparent screen (as of glass) that protects the occupants of a vehicle; especially : one in front of the occupants
sentence: The windshield was cracked by a rock.

definition: being worth the time or effort spent
sentence: Volunteering is a worthwhile activity.
